title: centennial Start a process with an html or txt or folder path is not longer working
body:
"System.Diagnostics.Process.Start(path);" with path pointing to a folder or a html file or a txt file etc results in
System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception (0x80004005): Class not registered
at System.Diagnostic.Process.StartWithShellExecuteEx(ProcessStartInfo startinfo)
at System.Diagnostic.Process.Start()

comments.body: Sorry for my late respond. The customer changed its mind and we created a real UWP app with much less features as in UWP a lot of needed APIs are not available. That's a pity, our centennial app worked when centennial was officially released.
Ferdi, are you still hitting this issue on Creators Update?

Is there something missing?
Our Application runs on a new installed Windows without specifying .html or .txt handlers in registry. We understood from Microsoft tutorials that most apps should just run on Windows 10 after being converted using centennial. If something is missing but available outside the app desktop container, it should be taken from normal registry, surely.
No, we did not specify any handler in the registry.
Are you specifying a .html or .txt handler in the registry?
